summary: The Brianna Lieneck Boating Safety Act of 2025 directs the Coast Guard to study and report to Congress on recreational vessel operator training. The study will encompass existing training programs (Coast Guard Auxiliary, Power Squadrons, and state programs), focusing on course materials, content, training methodology, assessment, and relevancy to risks. The report must include an analysis of state education program harmonization, reciprocity, minimum standards, potential for a federal program, and recommendations for experienced boater bypass options.
